Exaggerate: The claim describes the "Zombie deer virus" as "scarier than the coronavirus", which may be an exaggeration since there is no evidence to support this comparison.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or scientific sources to support the existence or severity of the "Zombie deer virus".
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the "Zombie deer virus" is a real and significant threat, without providing any substantial evidence or expert opinions to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert suggests that the claim may be referring to chronic wasting disease (CWD), a known disease in animals, rather than a new and unique "Zombie deer virus".
